title: R43466
content: Children in foster care have higher rates of mental health care needs and are more likely to be prescribed psychotropic medications. These medications are used to treat various mental health conditions, but there is limited evidence on their safety and efficacy in children. Congress is closely monitoring how states regulate the use of psychotropic medications for children in foster care, as federal law requires states to have a plan for overseeing prescription drug use in this population.
